title: pKa of KHP based on titration curve

content.question: A <math alttext="0.20 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solution of the weak acid potassium hydrogen phthalate (<math alttext="K H P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KHP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) is titrated with <math alttext="0.10 molar N a O H aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the titration curve shown in the graph above, the <math alttext="p K sub a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="K H P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>KHP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is closest to which of the following?

skill.text: 5.D: Identify information presented graphically to solve a problem.
